description.raw:
As of recent Anacondas (not sure when exactly), one gets errors about loading DLLS when launching labscript suite apps from shortcuts. We've gotten a few emails about this, but I had assumed they were all misconfigured installations and not our fault (since that is easy to do with pip and conda battling each other, and for many other lamentable reasons). Well, it turns out it's our problem after all. Newish conda needs you to activate the environment first. I checked out how spyder does it, and modified the installer to do that if it detects its being run from conda.

Also add quotes to the strings in the shortcuts to escape potential spaces in filepaths.

I have yet to test that this doesn't break on Python 2, and anaconda 2 does not seem to have the DLL loading issue in any case. But it should still be the same conda with the same environment variables, so I imagine it should still work. But will test soon (it just takes ages to install anaconda on Windows)
